t: Mark 11
And*p when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,

And*p saith unto them, Go*r your*r way*r into*r the*r village*r over*r against*r you:*r and*r as*r soon*r as*r ye*r be*r entered*r into*r it,*r ye*r shall*r find*r a*r colt*r tied,*r whereon*r never*r man*r sat;*r loose*r him,*r and*r bring*r him.*r
And*rp if*r any*r man*r say*r unto*r you,*r Why*r do*r ye*r this?*r say*r ye*r that*r the*r Lord*r hath*r need*r of*r him;*r and*r straightway*r he*r will*r send*r him*r hither.*r
And*p they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.
And*p certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?
And*p they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.
And*p they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.
And*p many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed them in the way.
And*p they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:
Blessed*p be the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.
And*p Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.
And*p on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:
And*p seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not yet.
And*p Jesus answered and said unto it, No*r man*r eat*r fruit*r of*r thee*r hereafter*r for*r ever.*r And his disciples heard it.

And*p they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;
And*p would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple.

And*p he taught, saying unto them, Is*r it*r not*r written,*r My*r house*r shall*r be*r called*r of*r all*r nations*r the*r house*r of*r prayer?*r but*r ye*r have*r made*r it*r a*r den*r of*r thieves.*r
And*p the scribes and chief priests heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.
And*p when even was come, he went out of the city.
And*p in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
And*p Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.
And*p Jesus answering saith unto them, Have*r faith*r in*r God.*r

For*rp verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r whosoever*r shall*r say*r unto*r this*r mountain,*r Be*r thou*r removed,*r and*r be*r thou*r cast*r into*r the*r sea;*r and*r shall*r not*r doubt*r in*r his*r heart,*r but*r shall*r believe*r that*r those*r things*r which*r he*r saith*r shall*r come*r to*r pass;*r he*r shall*r have*r whatsoever*r he*r saith.*r
Therefore*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r What*r things*r soever*r ye*r desire,*r when*r ye*r pray,*r believe*r that*r ye*r receive*r them,*r and*r ye*r shall*r have*r them.*r
And*rp when*r ye*r stand*r praying,*r forgive,*r if*r ye*r have*r ought*r against*r any:*r that*r your*r Father*r also*r which*r is*r in*r heaven*r may*r forgive*r you*r your*r trespasses.*r
But*rp if*r ye*r do*r not*r forgive,*r neither*r will*r your*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven*r forgive*r your*r trespasses.*r
And*p they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,
And*p say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?
And*p Jesus answered and said unto them, I*r will*r also*r ask*r of*r you*r one*r question,*r and*r answer*r me,*r and*r I*r will*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.*r
The*rp baptism*r of*r John,*r was*r it*r from*r heaven,*r or*r of*r men?*r answer*r me.*r
And*p they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
But*p if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
And*p they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither*r do*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.*r
